column1: Responsible action on #COVID19 has been delayed for months while @SpeakerPelosi plays politics and obstructs Paycheck Protection Program legislation. Congress needs to get back to work and leave political agendas at home. My latest opinion in @knoxnews ⬇️ https://t.co/dyIphB5R2m

I joined @6News to react to President Trump testing positive for COVID-19.  I'm praying for President Trump and the First Lady and wish them both a speedy recovery. Along with the rest of the nation I'm hoping for positive news in the coming days about the First Family’s health. https://t.co/Ixtt745lz6

The HEROES Act 2.0 is so irresponsible 18 House Democrats voted against it. Responding to COVID-19 needs to be for small businesses workers and families not advancing political agendas. https://t.co/Jhg4RcQaIJ

We can’t go home without a coronavirus relief deal – Speaker Pelosi on July 26.  Then she recessed the House when negotiations didn’t go her way.   She was right the first time. Congress needs to stay in town after Saturday’s messaging vote to work on a sensible relief bill.

At the same time its a shame @SpeakerPelosi is prioritizing messaging bills over a bipartisan Coronavirus relief bill. Congress needs to be in Washington working through the committee process ensuring all Americans' voices are heard to deliver an effective federal response.

Negotiations over the next #COVID19 relief package were a disaster and show Congress’ dysfunction. This is what happens if major decisions are left up to a few party leaders. Americans lose when Congress skips the committee process or refuses to work with the President.

If businesses are protecting their customers employees and public health they deserve to be shielded from frivolous COVID-19 lawsuits.  Liability protections are crucial to our economic recovery and they need to be part of the next #COVID19 relief bill. https://t.co/HRLfJdN2yM

The Summit supercomputer is making a difference in our nation’s fight against COVID-19. Many of the world’s best scientists are at @ORNL and I think it is wise to utilize them and Summit to lead our nation through this health crisis. https://t.co/80F8GkMSb9

President Trump is right to send federal agents to protect federal property. Big city mayors need to step up efforts to end destruction in their streets. I joined @FoxFriendsFirst to discuss this frightening violence plus the next #COVID19 relief bill. https://t.co/tE7WFBikGd

Today along with @DrPhilRoe and @RepJasonCrow I introduced the COVID-19 Veterans Memorial Extension Act a bill that would grant an additional fundraising year for proposed federal memorials honoring America’s veterans and military heroes.  Read more: https://t.co/Av4o0LH169

Attention East Tennessee small businesses: today is the deadline for #PaycheckProtectionProgram applications. If your business needs #COVID19 financial relief visit https://t.co/MkKSJCoV6d to learn how to apply. https://t.co/FUCh8uPpHp

The #ChineseCommunistParty deliberately covered up the #COVID19 outbreak and -- along with the @WHO's careless response -- prevented the world from properly and quickly responding to the virus. The tyrannical #CCP needs to be held accountable for their deception. @RepMcCaul https://t.co/cCIvkh8hFW

Due to #COVID19 many Americans have waited almost three months to hear back about their passport applications. Along with 34 of my colleagues I called on the State Department to resume passport operations and reduce its 1.6 million application backlog. https://t.co/c0sinWjzUv

I’m in Washington ready to work like the folks in East Tennessee expect us to. We need our elected-representatives in Congress to do their jobs and lead by example during this difficult time. Americans can adapt to coronavirus let’s get to work instead of living in fear. https://t.co/w2bqy1H9y6

#COVID19 created many changes in the lives of our family friends and neighbors. May is #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth and I encourage everyone to reach out to folks who may be struggling during this difficult time in our country. Together we will make it through this. https://t.co/2H9QuPfhJH

It's a shame Jamestown Regional Medical Center received federal #COVID19 relief funding. This hospital is closed owes millions in federal taxes and still hasn't paid its former employees. This is clearly a mistake and today I asked @SecAzar for an explanation how this happened. https://t.co/uNUJtWNwQY
I am joining @toddstarnes at 1:45pm to discuss the radical #HeroesAct what should be included in any future #COVID19 relief bill and other news of the day. Listen live here! https://t.co/urQb9j7wlG

Representatives need to be in Washington and work for their constituents. Today's proxy voting measure is a bureaucratic power grab requiring 20 members to pass a bill instead of 218. The House must adapt to #COVID19 and let Americans be represented by their elected officials.

The House should be returning to Washington for committee hearings and routine business not to vote on a liberal messaging bill that is going nowhere.   Republicans are ready to work on a #COVID19 relief bill as soon as @SpeakerPelosi is ready to get serious about legislating.

❌Wasteful use of taxpayer dollars on priorities unrelated to COVID-19 ❌Keeps American workers on the sidelines ❌Unconstitutional federal takeover of elections  @SpeakerPelosi I know you have to pander to your far-left members but let’s not waste the House’s time on this bill.

The United States Senate and some businesses are cautiously operating taking steps to protect from #COVID19. This is setting a great example for the rest of the country showing it is possible to safely go to work and protect yourself from #COVID19. Take note @SpeakerPelosi.

@SpeakerPelosi and @LeaderHoyer should not bring the House back just to vote on their #COVID19 messaging bill loaded with liberal priorities. This out-of-touch bill goes nowhere in the Senate. Let's get to work on a bipartisan bill that has a shot of getting to the President. https://t.co/wQzFQHuXr2
My message for #NationalDayofPrayer. Let’s pray for each other and all the folks who are keeping our country safe during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/OcuSo3RbwI
Thank you to all the nurses on the frontlines combating #COVID19. Take a moment to thank these folks for their efforts day in and out today. #NationalNursesDay https://t.co/CgtD2ZV2SX

We need to get our economy going again but need to do it safely. I joined @wbir to talk about the Coronavirus Public Safety and Economic Recovery Act my most recent bill that creates public health guidelines for businesses to keep their employees and customers safe. https://t.co/Bj2KHT0llM

I am live right now with @Hallerin on @987news! Talking about the Coronavirus Public Safety and Economic Recovery Act my most recent piece of legislation protecting employees and consumers as our economy reopens. Tune in!

America's businesses shouldn’t face lawsuits for reopening their doors if they’re proactively protecting their employees and customers. My legislation the Coronavirus Public Safety and Economic Recovery Act offers a shield to employers that follow official health guidelines.

The #PaycheckProtectionProgram has provided Tennessee small businesses with #COVID19 economic relief. According to the most recent @SBAgov data 75006 Tennessee #PPP applications have been approved totaling over $8.9 billion. Learn more about PPP here: https://t.co/inGUvjVivy https://t.co/QWxxPFkEXF

Isolation created by #COVID19 has serious consequences for our nation's mental health especially in rural areas. We need to look out for our family friends and neighbors during this difficult time. I recently spoke to @VICE about this important issue. https://t.co/OLrEdc9GBD

As our economy reopens and Americans go back to work the work environment needs to be safe. The Coronavirus Public Safety and Economic Recovery Act creates guidelines protecting employees and consumers while providing liability protection to employers. https://t.co/V3Ba8hJapK

#COVID19 has changed daily life in communities throughout East Tennessee. If you have a story to tell about how this pandemic impacted you please take the 'COVID-19 and You' survey on my official website. https://t.co/wkkeLUMMzv

The fourth #COVID19 response bill brings federal spending on this issue to nearly $3 trillion. Much of this money isn't even out the door but some of my colleagues are already talking about the next stimulus bill. Let what we spent take effect before asking taxpayers for more.

When the new #Coronavirus originated in Wuhan the Chinese Communist Party covered up its severity and let it get out of control. This ignorance has thrown the world into chaos. We must hold the CCP accountable for the harm its caused the Chinese people and the global economy.

So many Tennessee businesses and organizations are stepping up to help our communities during the #COVID19 crisis. Proud to see Tennesseans helping each other and looking out for their neighbors. Keep up the great work! #AmericaWorksTogether #InItTogether https://t.co/vo41DzbUHK

@SpeakerPelosi and @SenSchumer need to stop putting their liberal agenda ahead of struggling small businesses and workers. Read my op-ed on @FoxNewsOpinion about the urgent need to fund the Paycheck Protection Program now. #RefillPPP #Covid19 https://t.co/oSbw9dG1lj

The Paycheck Protection Program is OUT of money. On @6News I called for clean legislation providing more funding for PPP. Let's end the political games and help our small businesses and workers. #PaycheckProtectionProgram #COVID19 https://t.co/U295dHi56e

Almost 80 million Americans so far have received Economic Impact Payments included in the CARES Act. Are you wondering about the status of your payment? Check out the 'Get My Payment' section of the IRS' website. #COVID19 https://t.co/Foe0uZqD60

The Paycheck Protection Program is helping small businesses support their employees during this difficult time. Small business owners looking for financial support can apply for this program by visiting https://t.co/dFmIql11wx. #COVID19 https://t.co/ynHXecRUkC
Remember to do your part to #SlowtheSpread. Please continue to practice social distancing! #COVID19  #InThisTogether https://t.co/cg3PmsmzR3
Check out https://t.co/SgmB6TN3FG for more information on how to donate PPE (masks gloves hand sanitizer cleaning wipes etc.) to the COVID-19 response here in Tennessee. https://t.co/j1DvtIlFO4

We all still have a role to play in the ongoing fight against #COVID19. Please continue to follow the @CDCgov's social distancing and hygiene guidelines. Together we will #SlowTheSpread and beat this pandemic. https://t.co/AAw46U1HpA

Financial assistance in the CARES Act for the airline industry is meant for workers who can't go to their jobs and to help these businesses survive the #COVID19 economic fallout. Not a dime of this taxpayer-funded relief should go towards payouts for airline executives.
I will be joining @newsmax shortly to discuss the roll out of the Paycheck Protection Program and relief for our small businesses during the #COVID19 pandemic. Tune in!

This afternoon I sent a letter to more than 800 small business owners in East Tennessee as Coronavirus relief loans become available today. Please check directly with your financial institution for more details. https://t.co/J6GwtMF7Gf

Staff in my office has assisted 33 East Tennesseans traveling in seven different countries with repatriation during the COVID-19 pandemic and they are prepared to help others. If you are traveling abroad and need assistance please call my office at 865-523-3772 for travel help. https://t.co/TAAVA63MSo

Thank you to all the doctors on the front lines who are delivering lifesaving care during the #COVID19 crisis. Our doctors and healthcare professionals are so important to beating this awful disease. If you know any of these folks please take the time to thank them today. https://t.co/ZmKDyHCAdR

Instead of our country going in different directions to combat #COVID19 we need to put aside partisanship and solve this crisis together. Small businesses healthcare professionals workers and families all need help. Together let's pass the CARES Act and deliver that help. https://t.co/BGxSSif2hP
East Tennessee small businesses impacted by #COVID19 are eligible for loans through the Small Business Administration. Learn how to apply below! https://t.co/kUGl5zTVsc

As our nation continues to #socialdistance we must look to future. Americans will go back to their daily routines one day hopefully soon and they shouldn’t worry about #COVID19. That is why I’m calling on @realDonaldTrump to issue new health guidance for when this crisis ends. https://t.co/15JA7gwWq1
Teleconferenced with WATE this morning to discuss the #COVID19 stimulus package. Thanks for practicing good #SocialDistanacing with me @6News! https://t.co/eiaOoCtNDb

Heads up Social Security recipients: Beware of a scam letter threatening the suspension of your Social Security benefits due to the COVID-19 crisis. These letters are FAKE and @SocialSecurity has not suspended or discontinued benefits because of #COVID19. https://t.co/KbP8ksVUVm

Today I sent a letter to @AirlinesDotOrg President and CEO Nicholas Calio urging the airline companies not to use any taxpayer-funded financial assistance to pay out bonuses for industry executives. The money from the #COVID19 stimulus package is meant to help workers not CEOs. https://t.co/1iWDTtRhpk

Last week Senators worked together on a bill that would reduce the economic fallout from #COVID19.   Today millions are wondering why this bipartisan bill was blocked. Twice.   This bill helps struggling Americans but Speaker Pelosi blocked it in favor of her political agenda.

Social distancing has been key to limiting the spread of #COVID19 and #FlatteningTheCurve. @realDonaldTrump and the @CDCgov should continue pushing this practice while considering future health guidance for when folks can return to work and getting our economy back to full speed.

ICYMI: I held a #COVID19 telephone town hall with constituents last week. Right now Congress must legislate for the workers and small businesses that need help. Unfortunately as of today Washington politicians are still using #COVID19 to play politics. https://t.co/dROWjNdpCq

Our nation's public health and economic stability is at stake. Abortion rights the Green New Deal and other radical priorities have nothing to do with addressing the impacts of #COVID19. American workers and small business owners need to come first. Enough of this obstruction. https://t.co/HSZ5e3iEVy

I’m hosting a #COVID19 telephone town hall today at 3:35 PM. A representative from @TNDeptofHealth will be joining me to provide a #Coronavirus update as well as answer questions about how to stay healthy and receive assistance. Stream it live at https://t.co/w0LQruzmic
Please continue to practice social distancing. It can help you protect yourself your family your friends and your community from #COVID19! https://t.co/nU28HwO8TT

I will be hosting a #COVID19 telephone town hall tomorrow at 3:35 PM. A representative from @TNDeptofHealth will be joining me to provide a #Coronavirus update as well as answer questions about how to stay healthy and receive assistance. Sign up here: https://t.co/ZLhDa07NNI

Younger Americans are at less risk of contracting #COVID19 but nobody is immune. Even if you do not have #Coronavirus symptoms and aren't at-risk you still have an important role to play in preventing others from getting sick. Please practice social distancing! #FlattenTheCurve https://t.co/F7UJFM4m9f

#COVID19 has impacted our daily lives but the public health and safety community is working around the clock to combat the Coronavirus pandemic. Thank you to all the folks out there who are keeping Americans healthy and safe! https://t.co/FBIVOI298U

Remember to do your part in flattening the #COVID19 curve by following these tips to slow the spread. Practice social distancing use good hygiene and avoid unnecessary travel. It will make a positive impact in combating the Coronavirus! https://t.co/cVG79fDcI4

Glad to see the @SBAgov make this announcement. Tennessee small businesses economically impacted by #COVID19 can benefit from disaster assistance loans. I've urged @GovBillLee to declare Tennessee a disaster area which makes small businesses in Tennessee eligible for relief. https://t.co/28XrcMLrmy

My official website now includes a resource page for small businesses impacted by #COVID19. East Tennessee small business owners can check this page for updates learn about what resources are available and how to apply for financial assistance. https://t.co/y698lH690Z

Every American has a role to play in slowing down the #COVID19 pandemic and changing your daily activities can have a positive impact on the current public health situation. Follow these guidelines to keep yourself and others healthy and safe. https://t.co/RmkA3GgeJg

The Small Business Administration is ready to assist small businesses impacted by #COVID19. Small businesses should visit the SBA's official website to learn more about the available resources. @SBAgov https://t.co/4WL3TYZQrO

Stay up to date with #COVID19 developments using  @CDCgov's official website. Their homepage has tips for staying healthy mitigating community spread and what to do if you are sick. Please continue to follow their guidance. https://t.co/TM3l8niPwt
My statement on the Families First Coronavirus Response Act ⬇️ https://t.co/xztt5okwhY

The Coronavirus relief bill Congress votes on cannot be used as a political tool to advance the majority's agenda. We still have not seen the full text and I hope it is free of partisan poison pills. Congress needs to stay in Washington until this gets done and gets done right. https://t.co/HykSNW0oW4

My statement on @realDonaldTrump's national disaster declaration and additional response to the Coronavirus. I am glad the administration is expanding public-private partnerships as well as breaking down bureaucratic barriers to help improve and expedite testing. https://t.co/DMSMpuJkvt

Coronavirus has impacted public tours and popular attractions in Washington DC. If you are visiting our nation's capital soon or planning a future visit please use this resource page to stay up to date with the operating status of tours and attractions. https://t.co/SRC3mU1ron

I've heard the concerns from constituents about the recent outbreak of Coronavirus in Tennessee. It is important during this time to look out for the health and safety of our communities families and friends. Please stay safe and remember we are all in this together. https://t.co/RZFKzj1An2

@SpeakerPelosi and @HouseDemocrats using Coronavirus to permanently expand welfare and grow the size of the federal government is a new low. The American people deserve a much better bill that actually addresses the economic impact of COVID-19 on workers and businesses.

Avoid contracting or spreading COVID-19 by following these hygiene rules from the CDC. Paying close attention to your personal health and hygiene helps keep yourself and others safe! https://t.co/X92we7ORVY
Additional Coronavirus resources are available on my official website: https://t.co/Ri0qTNVzOp

Tennessee’s state and local health departments are well prepared to handle Coronavirus cases. It's important to follow guidance from health authorities to keep yourself and others safe during this time. Please take the appropriate steps if you think you have contracted the virus.

Glad House Leadership did the right thing and put forward a Coronavirus response package free of partisan poison pills. Policy riders don’t have any business in a bill our country needs to protect public health. I voted yes. https://t.co/OgLrYZru89
Still haven’t seen the Coronavirus relief package we’re supposed to vote on this week. Why? We need to make sure this is a clean bill. Joining @toddstarnes shortly to discuss.
I am paying close attention to any Coronavirus developments. You can keep yourself and others healthy and safe by following these basic hygiene rules from the @CDCgov. https://t.co/bkwZ77QhDK
This month's newsletter includes legislative updates Coronavirus info upcoming Mobile Office Hours and more. If you want to subscribe visit https://t.co/GpBnGxjllO https://t.co/5PTFR7nt1p

My full letter to @SpeakerPelosi and @LeaderHoyer. Public health is not a political game. We need to work together on a clean Coronavirus response funding package free of partisan tricks. https://t.co/xZkMO7xMOI

It is our belief and we believe the belief of most Americans that Congress should not tie these two unrelated issues together.  I led my colleagues in a letter to @SpeakerPelosi calling for separate bills for FISA reform and Coronavirus response funding. Read more below: https://t.co/xWC3IG2GPZ

Rumor has it Speaker Pelosi and her leadership team plan to offer Coronavirus response funding and FISA re-authorization in one bill. This is ridiculous. Congress cannot afford to play politics with urgent public health matters. We need to vote on a clean Coronavirus bill. https://t.co/POtFsDgdPf
